2. Distracted driving:
column6: usually causes the driver to drive slower.
column8: causes the driver to react more slowly to hazards.

column2: 3. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
4. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column6: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column8: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column10: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.

column2: 5. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.
column10: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.

column2: 6. This sign indicates:
column4: that you must not drive past this sign.
column6: the entrance to a dead-end street.
column8: the entrance to a construction site.
column10: that you must yield the right-of-way.

column2: 7. This warning sign:
column4: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column6: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column8: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column10: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.

column2: 8. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: reduce their speed and be prepared to stop.
column6: closely follow the driver in front of them.
column8: maintain their speed through the work zone.

column2: 9. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
10. At a light rail intersection, you should always:
column4: look both ways before crossing the tracks.
column6: be alert and obey all traffic signals.
column8: share the road with pedestrians and bicyclists.

column2: 18. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?

column2: 20. When changing lanes on a highway, drivers should:

column8: check the rearview and outside mirrors.

column2: 21. This sign warns drivers that:

column2: 22. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the right curb or edge of the road.

column8: on the left shoulder of the road.

column2: 23. Motorcyclists are entitled to use the full width of a traffic lane; therefore, a driver should pass a motorcycle the same way as passing another vehicle.
